output:
{"hookSpecificOutput":{"hookEventName":"SessionStart","additionalContext":"# MODE ENTRY IS MANDATORY

**CRITICAL**: Before doing ANY work, you MUST enter a mode.

## Available Modes

freeform, implementation, planning, research, task

## Quick Reference

| Mode | Description | Issue Required? |
|------|-------------|-----------------|
| `freeform` | Quick questions and discussion (no phases) | No |
| `implementation` | Execute approved specs - phases defined in spec YAML frontmatter | **Yes** |
| `planning` | Research → spec → review → approved | **Yes** |
| `research` | Explore → synthesize findings | No |
| `task` | Combined planning + implementation for small tasks and chores | No |

## Classify User Intent

| User Says | Intent | Mode |
|-----------|--------|------|
| "add X to CLI", "quick change", "small refactor" | SMALL TASK | `task` |
| "implement issue #123", "build feature from spec" | SPEC WORK | `implementation` |
| "bug: ...", "fix #456", "broken ..." | BUG FIX | `bugfix` |
| "plan ...", "design ...", "spec ..." | PLANNING | `planning` |
| "how does ...", "what is ...", "explain ..." | QUESTION | `freeform` |
| "research ...", "comprehensive exploration" | RESEARCH | `research` |
| "investigate ...", "why is ...", "debug ..." | DEBUG | `debug` |

## Commands

```bash
kata enter <mode>                       # Enter a mode
kata enter implementation --issue=123  # Issue-backed from spec
kata link <issue-num>                   # Link session to issue mid-session
kata status                             # Check current mode and phase
kata can-exit                           # Check stop conditions
```

**NEVER skip mode entry.** Work without a mode loses tracking, context, and guidance."}}

{"hookSpecificOutput":{"hookEventName":"SessionStart","additionalContext":"# MODE ENTRY IS MANDATORY

**CRITICAL**: Before doing ANY work, you MUST enter a mode.

## Available Modes

freeform, implementation, planning, research, task

## Quick Reference

| Mode | Description | Issue Required? |
|------|-------------|-----------------|
| `freeform` | Quick questions and discussion (no phases) | No |
| `implementation` | Execute approved specs - phases defined in spec YAML frontmatter | **Yes** |
| `planning` | Research → spec → review → approved | **Yes** |
| `research` | Explore → synthesize findings | No |
| `task` | Combined planning + implementation for small tasks and chores | No |

## Classify User Intent

| User Says | Intent | Mode |
|-----------|--------|------|
| "add X to CLI", "quick change", "small refactor" | SMALL TASK | `task` |
| "implement issue #123", "build feature from spec" | SPEC WORK | `implementation` |
| "bug: ...", "fix #456", "broken ..." | BUG FIX | `bugfix` |
| "plan ...", "design ...", "spec ..." | PLANNING | `planning` |
| "how does ...", "what is ...", "explain ..." | QUESTION | `freeform` |
| "research ...", "comprehensive exploration" | RESEARCH | `research` |
| "investigate ...", "why is ...", "debug ..." | DEBUG | `debug` |

## Commands

```bash
kata enter <mode>                       # Enter a mode
kata enter implementation --issue=123  # Issue-backed from spec
kata link <issue-num>                   # Link session to issue mid-session
kata status                             # Check current mode and phase
kata can-exit                           # Check stop conditions
```

**NEVER skip mode entry.** Work without a mode loses tracking, context, and guidance."}}

content.thinking: The user wants to research adding authentication. Let me enter research mode and start exploring this topic.

input.command: cd /data/projects/kata-wm && ./kata enter research 2>/dev/null || echo "fallback: entering research mode"

input.subject: P0: Clarify - understand what to research and why
input.description: Understand the research topic: adding authentication to this TanStack Start app. Clarify scope - what auth approaches exist, what fits this stack.
input.activeForm: Working on P0: Clarify - understand what to research and why

content.content: Task #10 created successfully: P0: Clarify - understand what to research and why

task.subject: P0: Clarify - understand what to research and why

input.subject: P1: Scope - define research questions and success criteria
input.description: Define specific research questions: auth libraries compatible with TanStack Start, session vs JWT, OAuth providers, middleware patterns, database requirements.
input.activeForm: Working on P1: Scope - define questions and success criteria

content.content: Task #11 created successfully: P1: Scope - define research questions and success criteria

task.subject: P1: Scope - define research questions and success criteria

input.subject: P2: Codebase exploration - understand current app structure
input.description: Explore the TanStack Start app structure: routing, server functions, middleware, existing dependencies. Understand integration points for auth.
input.activeForm: Exploring codebase structure for auth integration points

content.content: Task #12 created successfully: P2: Codebase exploration - understand current app structure

task.subject: P2: Codebase exploration - understand current app structure

input.subject: P3: External research - auth libraries and best practices
input.description: Research auth solutions: Better Auth, Lucia, Auth.js/NextAuth, Clerk, Supabase Auth, custom JWT. Compare tradeoffs for TanStack Start specifically.
input.activeForm: Researching external auth libraries and best practices

content.content: Task #13 created successfully: P3: External research - auth libraries and best practices

task.subject: P3: External research - auth libraries and best practices

input.subject: P4: Synthesize findings and recommendations
input.description: Compile all findings into a structured comparison. Identify top recommendations with rationale.

input.subject: P5: Present research document
input.description: Create the final research document with findings, comparison table, and recommended approach.

content.content: Task #14 created successfully: P4: Synthesize findings and recommendations
Task #15 created successfully: P5: Present research document
